DOC.brief_title: Community Partners Care Research Project Funded National Institutes Health
DOC.detailed_description: Underserved community color low income , largely ethnic-minority neighborhood face excessive burden illness depression due high prevalence depression low access quality care . Evidence-based quality improvement ( QI ) program depression primary care settings—where many low-income minority patient receive mental health care—can enhance quality depression care improve health outcome . These program under-utilized community-based health care setting , adapt use across diverse agency ( social service , faith base , primary specialty care ) could partner support disease management depression . Partners Care ( PIC ) WE Care intervention design improve access evidence-based depression treatment ( medication management psychotherapy ) primary care patient , WE Care , social service client . PIC evaluate service delivery intervention WE Care effectiveness trial study-provided treatment . Both study promote use evidence-based treatment . Both PIC WE Care program improve use evidence-based treatment depression health outcome African Americans Latinos . The PIC intervention reduce health outcome disparity evident usual care first follow-up year five-year follow-up . There evidence-based approach support agency network underserved community implement QI program depression . To address information gap , investigator create Community Partners Care ( CPIC ) , group-level randomized , control trial , randomization level agency site `` unit . '' The trial field two underserved community , Hollywood South Los Angeles , conduct community- participatory , partner research ( CPPR ) approach . The specific aim study : 1 . To engage two underserved community improve safety-net care depression . 2 . To examine effect community-engagement approach implement evidence-based depression quality improvement toolkits ( PIC/WE Care ) community collaborative network across service sector , compare technical assistance individual program service sector couple culturally-competent outreach implement toolkits . Our primary outcome long-term follow-up mental health relate quality life secondary outcome use healthcare community service depression physical functioning homeless risk factor .
